definition[0]: used to refer to a person or group of people when speaking or writing to them
example[2]: I have some news for you.
example[3]: The letter is addressed to both of you.
example[4]: Did Robin give you the money?
example[5]: Only you can make this decision.
example[7]: You boys have got to learn to behave yourselves.
example[8]: Hey, you over there! Get out of the way!
example[9]: You have to be 21 or over to buy alcohol in Florida.
example[10]: You can never be sure what Emily is thinking.
